Field.Description: Please leave blank. The corporate reporting team will provide an update on the action taken as a result of your feedback.
Field.Name: Outcome
Field.Title: Outcome

You can show a file from most applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, PDF, 3D, and others", "dataVersion": "1.4", "properties": {"authorName":"May-Parrott, Ben (BEIS)","chartitem":"","endrange":"","excelSettingsType":"","file":"{site}/Corporate%20Reporting%20Help%20Document%20Library/Corporate%20Reporting%20Help%20Guide.pdf","listId":"{listid:Corporate Reporting Help Document Library}","modifiedAt":"2018-10-26T19:58:15+01:00","photoUrl":"/_layouts/15/userphoto.aspx?size=S&accountname=Ben.May-Parrott%40beis.gov.uk","rangeitem":"","siteId":"{sitecollectionid}","startPage":1,"startrange":"","tableitem":"","uniqueId":"ecf94b10-a550-4985-afa5-83af7c3aad4c","wdallowinteractivity":true,"wdhidegridlines":true,"wdhideheaders":true,"webId":"{siteid}","webAbsoluteUrl":"{hosturl}{site}"}, "serverProcessedContent": {"htmlStrings":{},"searchablePlainTexts":{"annotation":"","title":"Corporate Reporting Help Guide.pdf"},"imageSources":{},"links":{"serverRelativeUrl":"{site}/Corporate%20Reporting%20Help%20Document%20Library/Corporate%20Reporting%20Help%20Guide.pdf","wopiurl":"{site}/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7becf94b10-a550-4985-afa5-83af7c3aad4c%7d&action=interactivepreview"}}, "dynamicDataPaths": {}, "dynamicDataValues": {}}

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Registering with and accessing the system

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: <p> <strong> BEIS Online Reporting – Registering with and accessing the system </strong> </p> <h1> Registering to the system </h1> <p> Getting access is simple and takes just a few steps: </p> <p> 1) Click <a href="https://corporatereportingapiprod.azurewebsites.net/"> https://corporatereportingapiprod.azurewebsites.net/ </a> ; </p> <p> 2) If asked, confirm your profile by clicking on your name. </p> <p> 3) </p> <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%"> <tbody> <tr> <td> <div> <p> user.name@beis.gov.uk </p> </div> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <p> Grant permission for BEIS Digital Dev to sign you in and to recognise your profile by clicking accept. </p> <p> This allows the database to recognise who you are, ensuring that it only brings back the content you need to see. </p> <p> 4) </p> <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%"> <tbody> <tr> <td> <div> <p> user.name@beis.gov.uk </p> </div> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <p> Grant permission for Corporate Reporting to sign you in and to recognise your profile by clicking accept. </p> <p> This associates your SharePoint identity to the reporting system, which means you will not have to register/sign in again. </p> <p> 5) Close the resulting browser page - do not click “sign out”. </p> <p> And that completes the registration. The reporting database will now recognise who you are and will present you with only the reporting information that you need to update. </p> <h1> Accessing the system </h1> <p> Access is via a weblink so, to make things easier for you in future, it is a good idea to save the page as a bookmark the first time you visit it. </p> <p> <strong>Please note</strong> – on accessing the system you can sometimes see a “Failed to fetch” error message in a pink box. <strong>P</strong> <strong>ressing refresh will usually resolve the issue</strong> and your content will load. </p> <p> 1) The system can be accessed at: <a href="https://beisgov.sharepoint.com/sites/beis/470/SitePages/Welcome.aspx" > https://beisgov.sharepoint.com/sites/beis/470/SitePages/Welcome.aspx </a> </p> <p> The screen you see will then be bespoke to you, depending on which reporting elements you are responsible for. </p> <p> <strong> Please refer to the guidance document for your particular role for more information on what you will need to do each month. </strong> </p>

Help for directors and SROs

Help for local administrators

 

Access to the system

You can find the system at  https://beisgov.sharepoint.com/sites/beis/470/SitePages/Welcome.aspx.
Save this link in your favourites or bookmarks for future use.

You will then see a screen which only displays reporting elements that are relevant to you.

If the screen is blank, contact your local administrator as they may need to assign you to the correct content.

Word limits

Like the spreadsheets that online reporting is replacing, many of the main reporting fields:

  • have character limits set on them
  • will reset to empty each month (although the previous month's RAGs and text will show as a reminder)

These changes are to stop returns becoming unwieldy over time, and to focus the reporting process on the current situation regarding delivery and how we need to respond to that.

Submit progress returns

As the system has an imposed deadline of the last day of the month for director or SRO sign-off, if you are unlikely to submit your progress on time to Portfolio Office you should contact your local administrator who will delegate completion to a colleague in your team. The system can give access for up to 4 people.

Depending on your role you may need to provide progress returns and RAG ratings for any or all of:

  • Key work areas
  • Milestones
  • Metrics or benefits
  • Project dependencies

In all cases the system will display what was entered for the previous month, and the progress fields will have some useful guidance on what sort of information is required.

Check that the current month is selected in the drop-down menu, and that you only update this month. The system can display this month and last month, to help PMO and Portfolio Office. 

Check that you click 'save' before you move away to another screen, or your update will be lost. You can return to edit your update whenever you like, but only your last saved version will be submitted when your director/SRO approves the whole return at the end of the month.

Some of the reporting fields have guidance prompts to help you with the kind of information required, and if you hover over any RAGbutton, screen tips will also appear giving definitions of the various statuses.

Close a report element when complete

When a milestone or key work area has been delivered (or it has been agreed hat it should no longer be delivered), you can close the element by checking the tick box which says 'Tick this box to mark this activity as closed. Only do this if delivery is complete and there are no more actions to take'. 

You will need to provide a final RAG and update on the reasons why you have closed the element, and for milestones, the date the element closed.

When you log in the following month, the element will not appear on your 'my updates' screen.

Track your work

Once you have started using the system, the home screen will show which items you have updated (a RAG) and which you haven't (a grey box which says 'to be completed').

Please check that all your returns are submitted at least a few working days before the end of the month as this will give your director or SRO time to complete the approval and submission process.

View reports

Full report: The 'My updates' screen shows only the elements that you need to edit but it is sometimes useful to see the full report. We have added a 'Draft Reports' page to facilitate this, that all users can see.

Previous months: When a report is approved, it is stored in the 'Report Archive'. All previously-approved reports for your Directorate or project are available to view there.

Submitting the directorate or programme/project overview

Although not many authors will be involved in this activity, you may be asked to:

  • provide a first draft of this part of the report for your director or SRO to sign off
  • provide this information directly if your director or SRO is unavailable

To do this:

  1. Select either the 'Directorate Report' or 'Project Report' from the top navigation menu
  2. If your director or SRO is responsible for several projects, choose the correct directorate, programme or project from the list and check the correct date is selected.
  3. You can then complete the relevant information, making sure you click 'save' at the end of the form.

Contacts and FAQs

Who to contact

In most cases, local administrators (usually either members of the Director's office or the programme/project PMO) play a vital part in co-ordinating the reporting process - they have been asked to introduce themselves to report authors.

Contact one of our team at corporatereporting@beis.gov.uk who can tell you who your administrators/reporting leads are.

FAQs

I can't see any content and there is a pink 'Failed to fetch' message.

Click the 'refresh' icon on your browser's menu bar will usually resolve this issue. If not, contact your local administrator who can check your permissions have been set up properly and you have registered correctly.

The information I entered is already showing as the previous month and the entry screen still says 'to be completed' even though the month hasn't ended

This is probably because your director or SRO has already approved the return. This changes the status of the data to 'submitted' and clears the screens ready for the next month's return.

You can still view this month's return if you need to amend it - select the current month from the dropdown menu above your progress update, and you can edit and re-save it. But to make sure that your new edit is included in the final report a local administrator will have to re-approve the full report.

I can't see a key work area or milestone that I need to update/I need a new one

Here you will need the report element assigned to you or added by your local administrator.

The details of the description, baseline dates etc are wrong

These can be easily changed in the administration part of the system by your local administrator.

Help for leads and contributors

Help for local administrators


Access to the system

You can find the system at  https://beisgov.sharepoint.com/sites/beis/470/SitePages/Welcome.aspx.
Save this link in your favourites or bookmarks for future use.

If the screen shows a 'failed to fetch' error, press the 'refresh' button on your browser menu and the content should load.

Deadline for report submissions

The system now operates to a hard deadline on the last day of the month for submissions to Portfolio Office. At midnight on the last day of each month the system resets, with all approved data becoming the return for the month that is ending, and all fields becoming blank ready for the new month's information.

If the report has not been approved at this point:

  • data will not be pulled through to the PFR/ExCo and Group reports created by Portfolio Office
  • data will not be visible for your team to see the next month.

If you will not be available or able to submit your return on or before the last day of the month, you must speak to your local administrator who can reassign access to the approval screen to another member of your team.

Structure of the report

The reporting is split into two areas:

  • individual report elements like key work areas and milestones (updated by the relevant lead)
  • the Project Overview (where headline messages and RAGs are provided - this is a separate reporting area which you can delegate to a team member to draft if necessary).

Either way, should you wish to, any information that has been provided by your team can be amended by the Director/SRO (or their delegated officer) at the review and sign-off stage.

Focus on delivery impact

Like the spreadsheets that online reporting is replacing, many of the main reporting fields:

  • have character limits set on them
  • will reset to empty each month (although the previous month's RAGs and text will show as a reminder)

This is to stop returns from growing over time into a complete history of the project and instead to help focus the reporting process on the impact that the current situation is having on delivery and how we need to respond.

Reviewing and amending the report

As Director or SRO, you will automatically be given access to the approval screen for the overall report for your directorate or programme/project.

  1. Make sure that the correct Directorate/Project and the current month are selected in the drop-down menus. The system allows access to this month and the previous one to help the PMO and Portfolio Office, but you should only ever need to approve the current month.
  2. The system builds and displays the return from all your team's entries (this can take a short time to load on first use). The headlines will show where information has been provided (if a deputy has produced a first draft for you) and where it is still required (greyed or blank cells).
  3. Click the pencil icon that appears above the overarching RAG status box to edit any element of the return.
  4. A pop-up screen will appear where you can edit the text. Once you have finished editing you must scroll to the bottom of the screen and click 'save' or your edit will be lost.

Signing off the report

Once you are happy with the report you can then scroll to the bottom of the review screen to click the approve button.

Please note – this button will not appear when you first access the review screen - if you have not edited this screen and are happy with the return it may still be greyed out. 

If this happens, the easiest way to activate the button is to change the report month in the drop-down list and then to change back to the current month. This should make the approve button live and turn blue.

If things aren’t quite right

For many of the items below, in the first instance you will need to contact your local administrator.

These are usually either members of the Director’s office or the programme/project PMO. Local administrators play a key role in co-ordinating the reporting process and have been asked to make themselves known to report authors.

If you don't know who your reporting lead is, contact a member of the corporate reporting team in Portfolio Office who will be able to let you know who your administrators are.

All admin changes happen quickly and are immediately live - refreshing your screen once the administrator has completed the request will show the updated version.

I can't see any content and there is a pink 'Failed to fetch' message

Pressing the refresh icon at the top-left of the browser screen will usually resolve the issue and your content will load. If this does not work you will need to contact your local administrator to check whether you have been given the correct permissions and whether you have correctly completed the registration process.

I cannot see a reporting element (key work area, milestone, etc.) that I need to update

In this instance you will need to have the report element assigned to you and you will need to contact your local administrator to do this.

The details of the report element (the description, baseline dates, etc.) are wrong

These can easily be amended in the admin side of the system but it will need to be completed by one of your local administrators.

I need a new reporting element (key work area, milestone, etc.)

New report elements can be added by your local administrators.

Help for directors and SROs

Help for leads and contributors

 

Your role as a local administrator

You will be either:

  • managing the system (eg creating new report elements, re-assigning ownership etc)
  • helping users with issues or problems (eg signposting for error messages etc)

Where administrators are asked by team members to help input data into reports, see the other Help sections in this guide for Director/SRO and contributor guidance.

Responsibilities of Portfolio Office vs. local administrator

Access to certain functions will be limited by the administration permission levels you have been given. Some areas are restricted to only the Portfolio Office because of how changes will affect reporting outputs.

Change reporting areas

This menu item in the left navigation is where admin users can make changes.

Portfolio Office can: Local administrator can:
Create or edit Groups  
Create or edit Directorates, including assigning directors  
Create or edit Projects, including assigning SROs  

Create new and edit existing report elements, including assigning leads and contributors:

Key Work Areas/workstreams

Milestones

Metrics/benefits

Dependencies

Commitments

Create new and edit existing report elements, including assigning leads and contributors:

Key Work Areas/workstreams

Milestones

Metrics/benefits

Dependencies

Commitments
Re-open incorrectly closed elements Re-open incorrectly closed elements


Currently only the Portfolio Office as admin users can:

  • create new and edit existing users
  • assign users to directorates and projects

Edit reporting elements

Although the information required differs for each element, the steps below are the same for key work areas (in directorates), workstreams (in projects), milestones, metrics/benefits, dependencies and commitments.

  1. Select the report element you want to update – a tick will appear next to its name. Click 'edit' at the top of the page.
  2. On the next screen you can change any of the fields associated to that reporting element.
  3. When you are finished editing you must click 'save' so your changes are not lost.

Note: for key work areas, milestones etc the edit screen for the report element is also where you assign individual team members to have lead or contributor access, so you can then edit them.

Create a new reporting area

Full report: The 'My updates' screen shows only the elements that you need to edit but it is sometimes useful to see the full report. We have added a 'Draft Reports' page to facilitate this, that all users can see.

Although the information required will be different for each element, the process identified below is effectively the same for key work areas or workstreams, milestones, metrics or benefits, dependencies and commitments.

  1. Click '+New' at the top of the page. This will open a screen where you can change any of the fields associated to that reporting element. 
    Note: The red asterisk shows required fields that you need to complete before saving.
  2. When you are finished editing you must click 'save' so your changes are not lost.

Assign users to reporting elements

Reporting elements and updates can be accessed and edited by one lead and up to three contributors. Users are assigned to specific elements by editing the properties of the element itself, not by editing the user’s profile.

Note: Admin users and the Director/SRO have the rights to edit everything in the return, so they do not need to be added as leads or contributors.


Resolving common issues

I can't see any content and there is a pink box with an error message

  1. Refresh your screen - this will usually resolve things and the content will load.
  2. If it doesn't, check whether the user has the correct permissions to view the specific content:
  • Are they an admin user for your area?
  • Do they appear as a lead or contributor on the relevant reporting element?

If you can answer 'no' to both questions, you'll need to give them access to the relevant item. See 'Assign users to reporting elements' above.

If you can answer 'yes' to 1 or 2 and they still can't see the content, please contact corporatereporting@beis.gov.uk.

The information I entered is already showing as the previous month and the entry screen again says 'to be completed' even though the month has not yet ended.

The most likely reason for this is because your Director/SRO has already approved the return. This changes the status of the data to 'submitted' and clears the screens ready for the next month’s return.

If the user is looking for this month’s return because they need to amend it, this can still be achieved.

If they select the correct month from the drop-down menu above their progress update they can then edit and re-save it. However, to make sure that that the edit is then picked up in the final report you will need to have the full report re-approved.

The process for this will need to be agreed locally and can be made either by the Director/SRO if the change is felt to be significant, or the admin user can temporarily assign themselves as a Director/SRO.

I cannot see a specific reporting element (key work area, milestone, etc.) for which I need to provide an update

It is likely that the user has not been assigned as a lead or contributor and you will need to add their name whilst having the appropriate report element open.

See 'Assign users to reporting  elements' above.

It may alternatively be that the specific reporting element has been closed incorrectly. This can be amended in the admin side of the system.

See 'Edit reporting elements' above.

The details of the report element (the description, baseline dates, etc.) are wrong

These can be changed in the admin side of the system. See 'Edit reporting elements' above.

I need a new reporting element (key work area, milestone, etc)

These can be added in the admin side of the system. See 'Create new report elements' above.

Finding what you're looking for

Filtering lists on admin screens

All the admin screens have a 'live' (predictive) search box at the top right that will look across every element of the system as you type.

Searching within a page

The 'Find on page' function in your browser is a useful way to locate updates, on what can be very busy screens with lots of information.

You can find this either by clicking 'CTRL' + 'F' on your keyboard, or clicking the three vertical dots at the far right of the menu bar, then scrolling down to 'Find'.

Your search term will be highlighted wherever it appears on the screen and, if it appears more than once, you can scroll through the results using the up and down arrows, with the current result being shown in orange and other results in yellow.
